title: Japan’s ‘Iron Lady’ Takaichi forges historic election win
byline: Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi’s coalition swept to a historic election win on Sunday, paving the way for promised tax cuts that have spooked financial markets and military spending aimed at countering China.

title: Fishermen’s ‘Satyagraha’ over seine fishing ban enters fifth day
byline: The Satyagraha campaign launched by a group of fishermen demanding the lifting of the ban on the use of tractor-mounted winches for Madel (seine nets) fishing activities continues for the fifth consecutive day today (09).

title: Bangladesh votes in world’s first Gen Z-inspired election
byline: For years under former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina, Bangladesh’s opposition had little presence on the streets during elections, either boycotting polls or being sidelined by mass arrests of senior leaders. Now, ahead of Thursday’s vote, the roles have reversed.

title: Mainly fair weather expected in parts of the island
byline: Showers or thundershowers may occur at a few places in Galle, Matara, Kaluthara and Rathnapura districts after 2.00 p.m, today (09), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Three dead, two injured in Amithirigala car–motorcycle collision
byline: At least three people have died in an accident involving a car and a motorcycle in Amithirigala, Thalduwa this afternoon (8), police stated.

title: 65-year-old attacked to death with sharp weapon in Haputale
byline: Investigations have been launched following information received by the Haputale Police regarding the death of a person who was admitted to the Boralanda Hospital after being attacked using a sharp weapon.

title: Hong Kong media tycoon Jimmy Lai sentenced to 20 years in prison in national security case
byline: Former Hong Kong media tycoon Jimmy Lai has been sentenced to 20 years in prison, ending a years-long legal battle that has come to define Beijing’s transformational crackdown on the once-freewheeling financial hub.

title: Iran’s Nobel winner Narges Mohammadi faces a new prison term of more than seven years
byline: Iranian activist and Nobel Peace Prize winner Narges Mohammadi, who has been imprisoned repeatedly in her three-decade campaign for women’s rights, was sentenced to a new prison term of 7-1/2 years, a group supporting her said on Sunday.

title: Suspect arrested with stock of heroin in Grandpass
byline: An individual has been arrested in the Siripalapintu Mawatha area of Grandpass for the possession of 25 grams and 150 milligrams of heroin.

title: Exposition of sacred Devnimori relics continues for fifth day
byline: The exposition of the sacred Devnimori relics of Lord Buddha, brought from India, continues for the fifth consecutive day today (09) at the Gangaramaya Temple in Hunupitiya, Colombo.

title: Person found dead under suspicious circumstances in Waskaduwa
byline: Police have discovered the body of a person who died under suspicious circumstances in a drain near a post box in the Waskaduwa area of Kalutara.

title: S. Korea ruling party to expel county head over controversial remarks on importing brides from Sri Lanka
byline: The ruling Democratic Party (DP) decided Monday to kick out the head of Jindo County over his controversial comments on “importing” women from overseas to cope with population decline.

title: Domestic postal charges revised with effect from today
byline: The Department of Posts has decided to revise domestic postal charges with effect from today (09).

title: Ven. Balangoda Kassapa Thero and others produced before court
byline: Ten suspects, including Venerable Balangoda Kassapa Thero and other monks, who are currently in remand custody in connection with the Trincomalee Buddha statue incident, have been brought to court.

title: 13-year-old killed in lorry accident in Udawalawe–Thanamalwila Road
byline: A 13-year-old child has died following a road accident on the Udawalawe–Thanamalwila road.

title: Over Rs. 3.2 bln paid as compensation to livestock farmers affected by Cyclone Ditwah
byline: Compensation exceeding Rs. 3.2 billion has so far been paid to farmers whose livestock farms were damaged by the Cyclone Ditwah, Deputy Minister of Agriculture and Livestock, Namal Karunaratne said.

title: Thailand’s Anutin readies for coalition talks after election win
byline: Thailand’s caretaker premier Anutin Charnvirakul was preparing for coalition talks Monday (February 9, 2026) after a stunning election victory for his conservative Bhumjaithai Party.

title: Ven. Balangoda Kassapa Thero and others further remanded
byline: Four Buddhist monks, including Ven. Balangoda Kassapa Thero, and six other individuals, have been further remanded until 11 February, 2026 by the Trincomalee Magistrate’s Court.

title: Bad Bunny makes history at Super Bowl LX with Lady Gaga, Ricky Martin
byline: Bad Bunny made history as the first Latin artist to deliver a Super Bowl halftime performance primarily in Spanish — and he went all out. The superstar staged an upbeat blowout for the books, complete with dancers, tons of Puerto Rican pride, and even a Lady Gaga guest appearance.

title: Govt to reconsider Protection of Occupants Bill, one-month period for comments – AG tells SC
byline: The Attorney General has informed the Supreme Court that the government has decided to reconsider the Protection of Occupants Draft Bill, which was recently presented to Parliament.

title: Petitions against decision to outsource e-visas to be taken up in March
byline: The Supreme Court has ordered that the Fundamental Rights (FR) petitions filed seeking to nullify the previous government’s decision to outsource the electronic visa issuance process to two private companies be taken up again on March 25.

title: Hearing of case against Yoshitha and his grandmother postponed to April
byline: The Colombo High Court today (09) has postponed the hearing of the case filed against Yoshitha Rajapaksa, son of former President Mahinda Rajapaksa, and his grandmother Daisy Forest, under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act, until April 24, 2026.

title: Ministry cannot express stance on fishermen’s protest until Feb. 27 – Dy Minister
byline: Deputy Minister of Fisheries and Aquatic Resources, Rathna Gamage, stated that the Ministry is unable to express a direct opinion at this time regarding the Satyagraha campaign initiated by a group of fishermen, which calls for the lifting of the ban on the use of tractor-mounted winches for Madel (seine nets) fishing activities.

title: Further hearing of GI pipes case against Keheliya in March
byline: The Colombo High Court has ordered that the further hearing of the case filed by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) against former Minister Keheliya Rambukwella and two others be taken up on March 14, 2026.

title: WhatsApp to soon get Instagram-style ‘Close Friends’ feature
byline: If you’re used to sharing selectively on Instagram, WhatsApp may soon let you do the same.

title: Myanmar hands over 500 MT of rice to cyclone victims in Sri Lanka
byline: The Government of Myanmar has donated 500 metric tons of rice to Sri Lanka to provide relief to people affected by Cyclone Ditwah.

title: SpaceX to build ‘self-growing city’ on Moon, Elon Musk says
byline: SpaceX has shifted its focus to building a “self‑growing city” on the Moon, which could be achieved in less than 10 years, chief executive Elon Musk says.

title: Several mortar shells discovered in Kalutara residential garden
byline: Several mortar shells have been discovered in the garden of a residence in the Parakum Mawatha area of Central Junction, Kalutara.

title: Chinese robot makers ready for Lunar New Year entertainment spotlight
byline: In China, humanoid robots are serving as Lunar New Year entertainment, with their manufacturers pitching their song-and-dance skills to the general public as well as potential customers, investors and government officials.

title: Chemmani Mass Grave: Decision on third phase of excavations due in March
byline: The Jaffna Magistrate’s Court is scheduled to announce its decision regarding the third phase of excavations at the Chemmani mass grave on March 16.

title: India provides financial assistance to 300 high performing O/L students
byline: The government is currently working towards transformative reforms across the education system and all sectors of the economy, Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya stated.

title: WHO confirms Nipah virus death in Bangladesh, risk of global spread low
byline: A woman in her 40s has died from Nipah virus infection in Bangladesh, the World Health Organisation (WHO) has confirmed, but says the risk of the disease spreading internationally remains low.

title: Police open fire at fleeing lorry in Ambalangoda; Duo arrested with ‘Ice’ and cattle
byline: Police opened fire at a lorry that failed to comply with orders to stop in Andadola, Ambalangoda today (09).

title: Russian President Vladimir Putin’s name appears 1,005 times in Epstein files
byline: Russian President Vladimir Putin’s name appears 1,005 times in the 3.5 million pages of correspondence linked to the late financier and convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, released by the US Department of Justice.

title: Police seek return of 103 fugitives through Interpol red notices
byline: Sri Lanka Police have issued Interpol red notices to secure the return of 103 suspects currently residing overseas, the Police Media Spokesperson, Assistant Superintendent of Police F. U. Wootler has stated.

title: Instagram, YouTube addiction trial kicks off in Los Angeles
byline: A California state court case over whether Instagram and YouTube harmed a woman’s mental health through addictive app design kicks off on Monday with opening statements, in a test of whether Big Tech platforms can be held liable for harming kids.

title: ADB appoints Shannon Cowlin as new Country Director for Sri Lanka
byline: The Asian Development Bank (ADB) has appointed Shannon Cowlin as its new Country Director for Sri Lanka.

title: Two arrested with Rs. 8 million worth of smuggled pesticides
byline: Two individuals have been arrested in Hemmathagama in connection with a consignment of pesticides and seeds valued at around Rs. 8 million, suspected to have been illegally imported into the country via sea.

title: Iran deepens crackdown following mass protests
byline: Iran arrested a prominent reformist, local media reported on Monday, deepening a crackdown on dissent following mass protests that posed one of the greatest challenges to the Islamic Republic since its inception.

title: 23 mortar shells recovered from property in Kalutara
byline: A total of 23 mortar shells have been recovered from a property in Kalutara today (08), Kalutara South police stated.

title: School transport services to be regulated amid ongoing education reform process
byline: A discussion on regulating school student transport services was held today (09) at the Prime Minister’s Office under the patronage of Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya, with the participation of officials from the National Transport Commission and the Ministry of Education.

title: Delegation arrives in Sri Lanka to facilitate return of Sacred Devnimori Relics to India
byline: A high-level Indian delegation to facilitate the return of the historic Sacred Devnimori Relics of Lord Buddha back to India on Wednesday (11).

title: 53 migrants, including two babies, dead or missing after boat capsizes off Libya
byline: More than 50 people have died, or are missing, after a migrant boat capsized off the coast of Libya, according to reports.

title: Tourist arrivals in February top 80,000
byline: A total of 80,776 tourists have arrived in the country thus far in February, data from the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority (SLTDA) shows.

title: South Korean official who suggested to import young women from Sri Lanka to boost birth-rate expelled from party
byline: A South Korean official who suggested the country “import young women” from “Vietnam or Sri Lanka” to boost its birth-rate has been expelled from his party.

title: 100 new cancer cases detected in Sri Lanka daily - Deputy Health Minister
byline: Approximately 100 new cancer cases are detected in Sri Lanka daily, Deputy Minister of Health Dr. Hansaka Wijemuni stated today (09).

title: Sri Lanka, EU to hold Joint Commission meeting on Thursday
byline: Sri Lanka and the European Union (EU) will hold the 27th Session of the EU-Sri Lanka Joint Commission in Colombo on Thursday (12).

title: JVP delegation holds talks with Gujarat CM to strengthen India-Sri Lanka ties
byline: A delegation led by the General Secretary of the JVP, Tilvin Silva has held discussions with Chief Minister of India”s Gujarat Bhupendra Patel today, focusing on strengthening India-Sri Lanka relations and exploring avenues for sector-specific cooperation.

title: India-Pakistan World Cup game to go ahead in Colombo as planned
byline: The much-anticipated India-Pakistan clash at the T20 World Cup 2026 is set to go ahead as per original schedule on February 15 in Colombo, following a resolution reached post Sunday’s tripartite meeting involving the International Cricket Council, Pakistan Cricket Board and the Bangladesh Cricket Board in Lahore.

title: China rejects US claims of secret nuclear tests
byline: China on Monday (Feb 9) denied US allegations it had conducted secret nuclear explosive tests, calling them “outright lies” and accusing Washington of making excuses to start up its own trials.

title: Cyclone Ditwah: Defence Secretary reaffirms commitment to post-disaster recovery process
byline: The official Validation and Finalization Workshop for the Post-Disaster Needs Assessment (PDNA) on the impact of Cyclone Ditwah was held today (09) at the BMICH, the Ministry of Defence said in a statement.

title: Education Council clears another hurdle
byline: The report of the expert committee appointed by the Ministry of Education to establish the proposed Education Council has been approved by the Parliamentary Sub-Committee on the establishment of the Education Council.
